Main content start



 

 
Welcome Class of 2027 and Transfer Students!
The Approaching Stanford and New Student Orientation (NSO) team is thrilled to welcome our undergraduate first-year and transfer students as the newest members of the Stanford family.
New Undergraduate Student Move-In Day: September 19, 2023
New Student Orientation (NSO): September 20-24, 2023
All new undergraduate students are required to live on campus and participate in New Student Orientation. The multi-day orientation will introduce you to the rich academic, social, and cultural life at Stanford. Plan to arrive to campus and move in to your residence on September 19 by 5:00 p.m.
If you are selected to participate in a pre-orientation program, you will need to arrive to campus a few days earlier. Dates and details will be provided by your program. International Student Orientation (ISO) will begin on Saturday, September 16. Students who are not US citizens/permanent residents are required to attend ISO. More information will be provided soon.
We invite family members to accompany your students to Move-In Day and the first day of NSO, September 19-20. Welcome events for students and families, including our Opening Convocation Ceremony, will be held on these days. Plan to say your goodbyes before dinner on September 20, so that students can join their dormmates for their first dinner and house meeting together.
If you arrive to the area before Move-In Day, we recommend that you book local lodging, as you cannot move in earlier than your designated move-in day. Local Lodging Guide
2023 Move-In and New Student Orientation information will be updated online this summer.





 

 
Stanford Indigenous Land Acknowledgment
Stanford sits on the ancestral land of the Muwekma Ohlone Tribe. This land was and continues to be of great importance to the Ohlone people. Consistent with our values of community and inclusion, we have a responsibility to acknowledge, honor, and make visible the University’s relationship to Native peoples.





 

 























 































 

 
A Note About Accessibility & Accommodations
Accommodations are available for those with accessibility or disability needs during New Student Orientation. Contact the Diversity and Access Office by calling (650) 725-0326 or emailing disability.access@stanford.edu for disability access information and/or to request assistance for NSO.
All NSO event locations are wheelchair accessible.
Web Accessibility
Stanford University is committed to providing an online environment that is accessible to everyone, including individuals with disabilities. Having trouble accessing any of this content due to a disability? Learn more about accessibility at Stanford and report accessibility issues.
